00045 static int
00046 remove_line(FILE* f) 
00047 {
00048   int count = 0 ;
00049   int c ;
00050   
00051   while (1) {
00052     c = fgetc(f) ;
00053     ++ count ;
00054 
00055     switch(c) {
00056     case '\n' :
00057       goto quit_remove_line ;
00058       
00059     case EOF :
00060       -- count ;
00061       goto quit_remove_line ;
00062     }
00063   }
00064  quit_remove_line :
00065   return count ;
00066 }
00067 
00075 static int
00076 remove_blanks(FILE* f) 
00077 {
00078   int count = 0 ;
00079   int c ;
00080   
00081   while (1) {
00082     c = fgetc(f) ;
00083 
00084     switch(c) {
00085       
00086     case '\t' : case '\n' : 
00087     case '\r' : case ' '  :
00088       ++ count ;
00089       break ;
00090 
00091     case '#' :
00092       count += 1 + remove_line(f) ;
00093       break ;
00094       
00095     case EOF :
00096       goto quit_remove_blanks ;
00097       
00098     default:
00099       ungetc(c, f) ;
00100       goto quit_remove_blanks ;
00101     }
00102   }
00103  quit_remove_blanks:
00104   return count ;
00105 }

00121 VL_EXPORT
00122 int
00123 vl_pgm_get_npixels (VlPgmImage const *im)
00124 {
00125   return im->width * im->height ;
00126 }

00139 VL_EXPORT
00140 int
00141 vl_pgm_get_bpp (VlPgmImage const *im)
00142 {
00143   return (im->max_value >= 256) + 1 ;
00144 }

00161 VL_EXPORT
00162 int
00163 vl_pgm_extract_head (FILE* f, VlPgmImage *im)
00164 {
00165   char     magic [2] ;
00166   int      c ;
00167   int      is_raw ;
00168   int      width ;
00169   int      height ;
00170   int      max_value ;
00171   int      sz ;
00172   vl_bool  good ;
00173   
00174 
00175   /* -----------------------------------------------------------------
00176    *                                                check magic number
00177    * -------------------------------------------------------------- */
00178   sz = fread(magic, 1, 2, f) ;
00179   
00180   if (sz < 2) {
00181     vl_err_no  = VL_ERR_PGM_INV_HEAD ;
00182     return -1 ;
00183   }
00184 
00185   good = magic [0] == 'P' ;
00186   
00187   switch (magic [1]) {
00188   case '2' : /* ASCII format */
00189     is_raw = 0 ;
00190     break ;
00191     
00192   case '5' : /* RAW format */
00193     is_raw = 1 ;
00194     break ;
00195     
00196   default :
00197     good = 0 ;
00198     break ;
00199   }
00200 
00201   if( ! good ) {
00202     vl_err_no = VL_ERR_PGM_INV_HEAD ;
00203     return -1 ;
00204   }
00205 
00206   /* -----------------------------------------------------------------
00207    *                                    parse width, height, max_value
00208    * -------------------------------------------------------------- */  
00209   good = 1 ;
00210 
00211   c = remove_blanks(f) ;
00212   good &= c > 0 ;
00213 
00214   c = fscanf(f, "%d", &width) ;
00215   good &= c == 1 ;
00216 
00217   c = remove_blanks(f) ;
00218   good &= c > 0 ;
00219   
00220   c = fscanf(f, "%d", &height) ;
00221   good &= c == 1 ;
00222 
00223   c = remove_blanks(f) ;
00224   good &= c > 0 ;
00225 
00226   c = fscanf(f, "%d", &max_value) ;
00227   good &= c == 1 ;
00228 
00229   /* must end with a single blank */
00230   c = fgetc(f) ;
00231   good &= 
00232     c == '\n' ||
00233     c == '\t' ||
00234     c == ' '  ||
00235     c == '\r' ;
00236   
00237   if(! good) {
00238     vl_err_no = VL_ERR_PGM_INV_META ;
00239     return vl_err_no ;
00240   }
00241 
00242   if(! max_value >= 65536) {
00243     vl_err_no = VL_ERR_PGM_INV_META ;
00244     return vl_err_no ;
00245   }
00246 
00247   /* exit */
00248   im-> width     = width ;
00249   im-> height    = height ;
00250   im-> max_value = max_value ;
00251   im-> is_raw    = is_raw ;
00252   return 0 ;
00253 }
00254 
00270 VL_EXPORT
00271 int
00272 vl_pgm_extract_data (FILE* f, VlPgmImage const *im, void *data)
00273 {
00274   int bpp       = vl_pgm_get_bpp       (im) ;
00275   int data_size = vl_pgm_get_npixels (im) ;
00276   int c ;
00277   vl_bool good = 1 ;
00278 
00279   /* -----------------------------------------------------------------
00280    *                                                         read data
00281    * -------------------------------------------------------------- */  
00282 
00283   /* 
00284      In RAW mode we read directly an array of bytes or shorts.  In
00285      the latter case, however, we must take care of the
00286      endianess. PGM files are sorted in big-endian format. If our
00287      architecture is little endian, we must do a conversion.
00288   */  
00289   if (im->is_raw) {
00290 
00291     c = fread( data,
00292                bpp,
00293                data_size,
00294                f ) ;
00295     good = (c == data_size) ;
00296     
00297     /* adjust endianess */
00298 #if defined(VL_ARCH_LITTLE_ENDIAN)
00299     if (bpp == 2) {
00300       int i ;
00301       vl_uint8 *pt = (vl_uint8*) data ;
00302       for(i = 0 ; i < 2 * data_size ; i += 2) {
00303         vl_uint8 tmp = pt [i] ;
00304         pt [i]   = pt [i+1] ;
00305         pt [i+1] = tmp ;
00306       }      
00307     }
00308 #endif
00309   }
00310   /* 
00311      In ASCII mode we read a sequence of decimal numbers separated
00312      by whitespaces.
00313   */  
00314   else {    
00315     int i ;
00316     int unsigned v ;
00317     for(good = 1, i = 0 ; 
00318         i < data_size && good ; 
00319         ++i) {
00320       c = fscanf(f, " %ud", &v) ;
00321       if (bpp == 1) {
00322         * ((vl_uint8* )  data + i) = (vl_uint8)  v ;
00323       } else {
00324         * ((vl_uint16*)  data + i) = (vl_uint16) v ;
00325       }
00326       good &= c == 1 ;
00327     }
00328   }
00329   
00330   if(! good ) {
00331     vl_err_no = VL_ERR_PGM_INV_DATA ;
00332     snprintf(vl_err_msg, VL_ERR_MSG_LEN,
00333              "Invalid PGM data") ;
00334     return vl_err_no ;
00335   }
00336   return 0 ;
00337 }
00338 
00348 VL_EXPORT
00349 int
00350 vl_pgm_insert(FILE* f, VlPgmImage const *im, void const *data)
00351 {
00352   int bpp = vl_pgm_get_bpp (im) ;
00353   int data_size = vl_pgm_get_npixels (im) ;
00354   int c ; 
00355   
00356   /* write preamble */
00357   fprintf(f,
00358           "P5\n%d\n%d\n%d\n",
00359           im->width,
00360           im->height,
00361           im->max_value) ;
00362 
00363   /* take care of endianness */
00364 #if defined(VL_ARCH_LITTLE_ENDIAN)
00365   if (bpp == 2) {
00366     int i ;
00367     vl_uint8* temp = vl_malloc (2 * data_size) ;
00368     memcpy(temp, data, 2 * data_size) ;
00369     for(i = 0 ; i < 2 * data_size ; i += 2) {
00370       vl_uint8 tmp = temp [i] ;
00371       temp [i]   = temp [i+1] ;
00372       temp [i+1] = tmp ;
00373     }
00374     c = fwrite(temp, 2, data_size, f) ;
00375     vl_free (temp) ;
00376   }
00377   else {
00378 #endif
00379     c = fwrite(data, bpp, data_size, f) ;
00380 #if defined(VL_ARCH_LITTLE_ENDIAN)  
00381   }
00382 #endif
00383   
00384   if(c != data_size) {
00385     vl_err_no = VL_ERR_PGM_IO ;
00386     snprintf(vl_err_msg, VL_ERR_MSG_LEN,
00387              "Error writing PGM data") ;
00388     return vl_err_no ;
00389   }
00390   return 0 ;
00391 }
00392 
00411 VL_EXPORT
00412 int vl_pgm_read_new (char const *name, VlPgmImage *im, vl_uint8** data)
00413 {
00414   int err = 0 ;
00415 
00416   FILE *f = fopen (name, "rb") ;
00417   
00418   if (! f) {
00419     vl_err_no = VL_ERR_PGM_IO ;
00420     snprintf(vl_err_msg, VL_ERR_MSG_LEN,
00421              "Error opening PGM file `%s' for reading", name) ;
00422     return vl_err_no ;
00423   }
00424   
00425   err = vl_pgm_extract_head(f, im) ;
00426   if (err) {
00427     fclose (f) ;
00428     return err ;
00429   }
00430   
00431   if (vl_pgm_get_bpp(im) > 1) {
00432     vl_err_no = VL_ERR_BAD_ARG ;
00433     snprintf(vl_err_msg, VL_ERR_MSG_LEN,
00434              "vl_pgm_read(): PGM with BPP > 1 not supported") ;
00435     return vl_err_no ;
00436   }
00437   
00438   *data = vl_malloc (vl_pgm_get_npixels(im) * sizeof(vl_uint8)) ;
00439   err = vl_pgm_extract_data(f, im, *data) ;
00440   
00441   if (err) {
00442     vl_free (data) ;
00443     fclose (f) ;
00444   }
00445   
00446   fclose (f) ;  
00447   return err ;
00448 }
00449 
00469 VL_EXPORT
00470 int vl_pgm_read_new_f (char const *name,  VlPgmImage *im, float** data)
00471 {
00472   int err = 0 ;
00473   size_t npixels ;
00474   vl_uint8 *idata ;
00475   
00476   err = vl_pgm_read_new (name, im, &idata) ;
00477   if (err) {
00478     return err ;
00479   }
00480   
00481   npixels = vl_pgm_get_npixels(im) ;
00482   *data = vl_malloc (sizeof(float) * npixels) ;
00483   {
00484     size_t k ;
00485     float scale = 1.0f / im->max_value ;
00486     for (k = 0 ; k < npixels ; ++ k) (*data)[k] = scale * idata[k] ;
00487   }
00488   
00489   vl_free (idata) ;
00490   return err ;
00491 }
00492 
00508 VL_EXPORT
00509 int vl_pgm_write (char const *name, vl_uint8 const* data, int width, int height)
00510 {
00511   int err = 0 ;
00512   VlPgmImage pgm ;
00513   
00514   FILE *f = fopen (name, "wb") ;
00515   
00516   if (! f) {
00517     vl_err_no = VL_ERR_PGM_IO ;
00518     snprintf(vl_err_msg, VL_ERR_MSG_LEN,
00519              "Error opening PGM file for writing") ;
00520     return vl_err_no ;
00521   }
00522     
00523   pgm.width = width ;
00524   pgm.height = height ;
00525   pgm.is_raw = 1 ;
00526   pgm.max_value = 255 ;
00527   
00528   err = vl_pgm_insert (f, &pgm, data) ;
00529   fclose (f) ;
00530   
00531   return err ;
00532 }
00533 
00550 VL_EXPORT
00551 int vl_pgm_write_f (char const *name, float const* data, int width, int height)
00552 {
00553   int err = 0 ;
00554   int k ;
00555   float min = + VL_INFINITY_F ;
00556   float max = - VL_INFINITY_F ;
00557   float scale ;
00558   
00559   vl_uint8 * buffer = vl_malloc (sizeof(float) * width * height) ;
00560   
00561   for (k = 0 ; k < width * height ; ++k) {
00562     min = VL_MIN(min, data [k]) ;
00563     max = VL_MAX(max, data [k]) ;
00564   }
00565   
00566   scale = 255 / (max - min + VL_EPSILON_F) ;
00567   
00568   for (k = 0 ; k < width * height ; ++k) {
00569     buffer [k] = (vl_uint8) ((data [k] - min) * scale) ;
00570   }
00571   
00572   err = vl_pgm_write (name, buffer, width, height) ;
00573   
00574   vl_free (buffer) ;  
00575   return err ;
00576 }
